Question_1.Context: In organic chemistry, callus differentiation refers to the process where undifferentiated cells in plants, known as callus, develop into specialized cells or tissues.
Question_1.Question: What is callus differentiation?
Question_1.A: The process where specialized cells in plants develop into undifferentiated cells
Question_1.B: The process where undifferentiated cells in plants develop into specialized cells or tissues
Question_1.C: The process of increasing the size of plant cells by water absorption
Question_1.D: The process of plant cells dividing to form identical daughter cells
Question_1.Source: Optimisation of culture conditions for gesho (Rhamnus prinoides.L) callus differentiation using Artificial Neural Network-Genetic Algorithm (ANN-GA) Techniques.
